00012 
00013 // Register names according to the datasheet.
00014 // According to the InvenSense document
00015 // "MPU-6000 and MPU-6050 Register Map
00016 // and Descriptions Revision 3.2", there are no registers
00017 // at 0x02 ... 0x18, but according other information
00018 // the registers in that unknown area are for gain
00019 // and offsets.
00020 //
00021 #define MPU6050_AUX_VDDIO          0x01   // R/W
00022 #define MPU6050_SMPLRT_DIV         0x19   // R/W
00023 #define MPU6050_CONFIG             0x1A   // R/W
00024 #define MPU6050_GYRO_CONFIG        0x1B   // R/W
00025 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_CONFIG       0x1C   // R/W
00026 #define MPU6050_FF_THR             0x1D   // R/W
00027 #define MPU6050_FF_DUR             0x1E   // R/W
00028 #define MPU6050_MOT_THR            0x1F   // R/W
00029 #define MPU6050_MOT_DUR            0x20   // R/W
00030 #define MPU6050_ZRMOT_THR          0x21   // R/W
00031 #define MPU6050_ZRMOT_DUR          0x22   // R/W
00032 #define MPU6050_FIFO_EN            0x23   // R/W
00033 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_CTRL       0x24   // R/W
00034 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_ADDR      0x25   // R/W
00035 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_REG       0x26   // R/W
00036 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_CTRL      0x27   // R/W
00037 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_ADDR      0x28   // R/W
00038 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_REG       0x29   // R/W
00039 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_CTRL      0x2A   // R/W
00040 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_ADDR      0x2B   // R/W
00041 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_REG       0x2C   // R/W
00042 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_CTRL      0x2D   // R/W
00043 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_ADDR      0x2E   // R/W
00044 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_REG       0x2F   // R/W
00045 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_CTRL      0x30   // R/W
00046 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_ADDR      0x31   // R/W
00047 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_REG       0x32   // R/W
00048 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_DO        0x33   // R/W
00049 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_CTRL      0x34   // R/W
00050 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_DI        0x35   // R
00051 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_STATUS     0x36   // R
00052 #define MPU6050_INT_PIN_CFG        0x37   // R/W
00053 #define MPU6050_INT_ENABLE         0x38   // R/W
00054 #define MPU6050_INT_STATUS         0x3A   // R
00055 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_XOUT_H       0x3B   // R
00056 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_XOUT_L       0x3C   // R
00057 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_YOUT_H       0x3D   // R
00058 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_YOUT_L       0x3E   // R
00059 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ZOUT_H       0x3F   // R
00060 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ZOUT_L       0x40   // R
00061 #define MPU6050_TEMP_OUT_H         0x41   // R
00062 #define MPU6050_TEMP_OUT_L         0x42   // R
00063 #define MPU6050_GYRO_XOUT_H        0x43   // R
00064 #define MPU6050_GYRO_XOUT_L        0x44   // R
00065 #define MPU6050_GYRO_YOUT_H        0x45   // R
00066 #define MPU6050_GYRO_YOUT_L        0x46   // R
00067 #define MPU6050_GYRO_ZOUT_H        0x47   // R
00068 #define MPU6050_GYRO_ZOUT_L        0x48   // R
00069 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_00   0x49   // R
00070 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_01   0x4A   // R
00071 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_02   0x4B   // R
00072 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_03   0x4C   // R
00073 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_04   0x4D   // R
00074 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_05   0x4E   // R
00075 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_06   0x4F   // R
00076 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_07   0x50   // R
00077 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_08   0x51   // R
00078 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_09   0x52   // R
00079 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_10   0x53   // R
00080 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_11   0x54   // R
00081 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_12   0x55   // R
00082 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_13   0x56   // R
00083 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_14   0x57   // R
00084 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_15   0x58   // R
00085 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_16   0x59   // R
00086 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_17   0x5A   // R
00087 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_18   0x5B   // R
00088 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_19   0x5C   // R
00089 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_20   0x5D   // R
00090 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_21   0x5E   // R
00091 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_22   0x5F   // R
00092 #define MPU6050_EXT_SENS_DATA_23   0x60   // R
00093 #define MPU6050_MOT_DETECT_STATUS  0x61   // R
00094 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_DO        0x63   // R/W
00095 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_DO        0x64   // R/W
00096 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_DO        0x65   // R/W
00097 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_DO        0x66   // R/W
00098 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DELAY_CTRL 0x67   // R/W
00099 #define MPU6050_SIGNAL_PATH_RESET  0x68   // R/W
00100 #define MPU6050_MOT_DETECT_CTRL    0x69   // R/W
00101 #define MPU6050_USER_CTRL          0x6A   // R/W
00102 #define MPU6050_PWR_MGMT_1         0x6B   // R/W
00103 #define MPU6050_PWR_MGMT_2         0x6C   // R/W
00104 #define MPU6050_FIFO_COUNTH        0x72   // R/W
00105 #define MPU6050_FIFO_COUNTL        0x73   // R/W
00106 #define MPU6050_FIFO_R_W           0x74   // R/W
00107 #define MPU6050_WHO_AM_I           0x75   // R
00108 
00109 
00110 // Defines for the bits, to be able to change
00111 // between bit number and binary definition.
00112 // By using the bit number, programming the sensor
00113 // is like programming the AVR microcontroller.
00114 // But instead of using "(1<<X)", or "_BV(X)",
00115 // the Arduino "bit(X)" is used.
00116 #define MPU6050_D0 0
00117 #define MPU6050_D1 1
00118 #define MPU6050_D2 2
00119 #define MPU6050_D3 3
00120 #define MPU6050_D4 4
00121 #define MPU6050_D5 5
00122 #define MPU6050_D6 6
00123 #define MPU6050_D7 7
00124 
00125 // AUX_VDDIO Register
00126 #define MPU6050_AUX_VDDIO MPU6050_D7  // I2C high: 1=VDD, 0=VLOGIC
00127 
00128 // CONFIG Register
00129 // DLPF is Digital Low Pass Filter for both gyro and accelerometers.
00130 // These are the names for the bits.
00131 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00132 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG0     MPU6050_D0
00133 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG1     MPU6050_D1
00134 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG2     MPU6050_D2
00135 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET0 MPU6050_D3
00136 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET1 MPU6050_D4
00137 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET2 MPU6050_D5
00138 
00139 // Combined definitions for the EXT_SYNC_SET values
00140 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_0 (0)
00141 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_1 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET0))
00142 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_2 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET1))
00143 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_3 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET1)|bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET0))
00144 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_4 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET2))
00145 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_5 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET2)|bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET0))
00146 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_6 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET2)|bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET1))
00147 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_7 (bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET2)|bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET1)|bit(MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET0))
00148 
00149 // Alternative names for the combined definitions.
00150 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_DISABLED     MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_0
00151 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_TEMP_OUT_L   MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_1
00152 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_GYRO_XOUT_L  MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_2
00153 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_GYRO_YOUT_L  MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_3
00154 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_GYRO_ZOUT_L  MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_4
00155 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_ACCEL_XOUT_L MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_5
00156 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_ACCEL_YOUT_L MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_6
00157 #define MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_ACCEL_ZOUT_L MPU6050_EXT_SYNC_SET_7
00158 
00159 // Combined definitions for the DLPF_CFG values
00160 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_0 (0)
00161 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_1 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG0))
00162 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_2 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG1))
00163 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_3 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG1)|bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG0))
00164 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_4 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG2))
00165 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_5 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG2)|bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG0))
00166 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_6 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG2)|bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG1))
00167 #define MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_7 (bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG2)|bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG1)|bit(MPU6050_DLPF_CFG0))
00168 
00169 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00170 // This name uses the bandwidth (Hz) for the accelometer,
00171 // for the gyro the bandwidth is almost the same.
00172 #define MPU6050_DLPF_260HZ    MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_0
00173 #define MPU6050_DLPF_184HZ    MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_1
00174 #define MPU6050_DLPF_94HZ     MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_2
00175 #define MPU6050_DLPF_44HZ     MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_3
00176 #define MPU6050_DLPF_21HZ     MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_4
00177 #define MPU6050_DLPF_10HZ     MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_5
00178 #define MPU6050_DLPF_5HZ      MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_6
00179 #define MPU6050_DLPF_RESERVED MPU6050_DLPF_CFG_7
00180 
00181 // GYRO_CONFIG Register
00182 // The XG_ST, YG_ST, ZG_ST are bits for selftest.
00183 // The FS_SEL sets the range for the gyro.
00184 // These are the names for the bits.
00185 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00186 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL0 MPU6050_D3
00187 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL1 MPU6050_D4
00188 #define MPU6050_ZG_ST   MPU6050_D5
00189 #define MPU6050_YG_ST   MPU6050_D6
00190 #define MPU6050_XG_ST   MPU6050_D7
00191 
00192 // Combined definitions for the FS_SEL values
00193 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_0 (0)
00194 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_1 (bit(MPU6050_FS_SEL0))
00195 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_2 (bit(MPU6050_FS_SEL1))
00196 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_3 (bit(MPU6050_FS_SEL1)|bit(MPU6050_FS_SEL0))
00197 
00198 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00199 // The name uses the range in degrees per second.
00200 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_250  MPU6050_FS_SEL_0
00201 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_500  MPU6050_FS_SEL_1
00202 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_1000 MPU6050_FS_SEL_2
00203 #define MPU6050_FS_SEL_2000 MPU6050_FS_SEL_3
00204 
00205 // ACCEL_CONFIG Register
00206 // The XA_ST, YA_ST, ZA_ST are bits for selftest.
00207 // The AFS_SEL sets the range for the accelerometer.
00208 // These are the names for the bits.
00209 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00210 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF0 MPU6050_D0
00211 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF1 MPU6050_D1
00212 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF2 MPU6050_D2
00213 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL0   MPU6050_D3
00214 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL1   MPU6050_D4
00215 #define MPU6050_ZA_ST      MPU6050_D5
00216 #define MPU6050_YA_ST      MPU6050_D6
00217 #define MPU6050_XA_ST      MPU6050_D7
00218 
00219 // Combined definitions for the ACCEL_HPF values
00220 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_0 (0)
00221 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_1 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF0))
00222 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_2 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF1))
00223 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_3 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF1)|bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF0))
00224 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_4 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF2))
00225 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_7 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF2)|bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF1)|bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF0))
00226 
00227 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00228 // The name uses the Cut-off frequency.
00229 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_RESET  MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_0
00230 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_5HZ    MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_1
00231 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_2_5HZ  MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_2

00234 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_HOLD   MPU6050_ACCEL_HPF_7

00236 // Combined definitions for the AFS_SEL values
00237 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL_0 (0)
00238 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL_1 (bit(MPU6050_AFS_SEL0))
00239 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL_2 (bit(MPU6050_AFS_SEL1))
00240 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL_3 (bit(MPU6050_AFS_SEL1)|bit(MPU6050_AFS_SEL0))
00241 
00242 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00243 // The name uses the full scale range for the accelerometer.
00244 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL_2G  MPU6050_AFS_SEL_0
00245 #define MPU6050_AFS_SEL_4G  MPU6050_AFS_SEL_1

00316 // These are the names for the bits.
00317 // Use these only with the bit() macro.

00319 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_LEN1    MPU6050_D1
00320 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_LEN2    MPU6050_D2
00321 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_LEN3    MPU6050_D3
00322 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_GRP     MPU6050_D4
00323 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_REG_DIS MPU6050_D5
00324 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_BYTE_SW MPU6050_D6
00325 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_EN      MPU6050_D7
00326 
00327 // A mask for the length
00328 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_LEN_MASK 0x0F
00329 
00330 // I2C_SLV1_ADDR Register
00331 // These are the names for the bits.
00332 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00333 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_RW MPU6050_D7
00334 
00335 // I2C_SLV1_CTRL Register
00336 // These are the names for the bits.
00337 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00338 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_LEN0    MPU6050_D0
00339 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_LEN1    MPU6050_D1
00340 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_LEN2    MPU6050_D2
00341 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_LEN3    MPU6050_D3
00342 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_GRP     MPU6050_D4
00343 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_REG_DIS MPU6050_D5
00344 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_BYTE_SW MPU6050_D6
00345 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_EN      MPU6050_D7
00346 
00347 // A mask for the length
00348 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_LEN_MASK 0x0F
00349 
00350 // I2C_SLV2_ADDR Register
00351 // These are the names for the bits.
00352 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00353 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_RW MPU6050_D7
00354 
00355 // I2C_SLV2_CTRL Register
00356 // These are the names for the bits.
00357 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00358 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_LEN0    MPU6050_D0
00359 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_LEN1    MPU6050_D1
00360 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_LEN2    MPU6050_D2
00361 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_LEN3    MPU6050_D3
00362 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_GRP     MPU6050_D4
00363 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_REG_DIS MPU6050_D5
00364 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_BYTE_SW MPU6050_D6
00365 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_EN      MPU6050_D7
00366 
00367 // A mask for the length
00368 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_LEN_MASK 0x0F
00369 
00370 // I2C_SLV3_ADDR Register
00371 // These are the names for the bits.
00372 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00373 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_RW MPU6050_D7
00374 
00375 // I2C_SLV3_CTRL Register
00376 // These are the names for the bits.
00377 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00378 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_LEN0    MPU6050_D0
00379 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_LEN1    MPU6050_D1
00380 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_LEN2    MPU6050_D2
00381 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_LEN3    MPU6050_D3
00382 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_GRP     MPU6050_D4
00383 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_REG_DIS MPU6050_D5
00384 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_BYTE_SW MPU6050_D6
00385 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_EN      MPU6050_D7
00386 
00387 // A mask for the length
00388 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_LEN_MASK 0x0F
00389 
00390 // I2C_SLV4_ADDR Register
00391 // These are the names for the bits.
00392 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00393 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_RW MPU6050_D7
00394 
00395 // I2C_SLV4_CTRL Register
00396 // These are the names for the bits.
00397 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00398 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DLY0     MPU6050_D0
00399 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DLY1     MPU6050_D1
00400 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DLY2     MPU6050_D2
00401 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DLY3     MPU6050_D3
00402 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DLY4     MPU6050_D4
00403 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_REG_DIS MPU6050_D5
00404 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_INT_EN  MPU6050_D6
00405 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_EN      MPU6050_D7
00406 
00407 // A mask for the delay
00408 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_DLY_MASK 0x1F
00409 
00410 // I2C_MST_STATUS Register
00411 // These are the names for the bits.
00412 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00413 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_NACK MPU6050_D0
00414 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_NACK MPU6050_D1
00415 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_NACK MPU6050_D2
00416 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_NACK MPU6050_D3
00417 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_NACK MPU6050_D4
00418 #define MPU6050_I2C_LOST_ARB  MPU6050_D5
00419 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_DONE MPU6050_D6
00420 #define MPU6050_PASS_THROUGH  MPU6050_D7
00421 
00422 // I2C_PIN_CFG Register
00423 // These are the names for the bits.
00424 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00425 #define MPU6050_CLKOUT_EN       MPU6050_D0
00426 #define MPU6050_I2C_BYPASS_EN   MPU6050_D1
00427 #define MPU6050_FSYNC_INT_EN    MPU6050_D2
00428 #define MPU6050_FSYNC_INT_LEVEL MPU6050_D3
00429 #define MPU6050_INT_RD_CLEAR    MPU6050_D4
00430 #define MPU6050_LATCH_INT_EN    MPU6050_D5
00431 #define MPU6050_INT_OPEN        MPU6050_D6
00432 #define MPU6050_INT_LEVEL       MPU6050_D7
00433 
00434 // INT_ENABLE Register
00435 // These are the names for the bits.
00436 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00437 #define MPU6050_DATA_RDY_EN    MPU6050_D0
00438 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_INT_EN MPU6050_D3
00439 #define MPU6050_FIFO_OFLOW_EN  MPU6050_D4
00440 #define MPU6050_ZMOT_EN        MPU6050_D5
00441 #define MPU6050_MOT_EN         MPU6050_D6
00442 #define MPU6050_FF_EN          MPU6050_D7
00443 
00444 // INT_STATUS Register
00445 // These are the names for the bits.
00446 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00447 #define MPU6050_DATA_RDY_INT   MPU6050_D0
00448 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_INT    MPU6050_D3
00449 #define MPU6050_FIFO_OFLOW_INT MPU6050_D4
00450 #define MPU6050_ZMOT_INT       MPU6050_D5
00451 #define MPU6050_MOT_INT        MPU6050_D6
00452 #define MPU6050_FF_INT         MPU6050_D7
00453 
00454 // MOT_DETECT_STATUS Register
00455 // These are the names for the bits.
00456 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00457 #define MPU6050_MOT_ZRMOT MPU6050_D0
00458 #define MPU6050_MOT_ZPOS  MPU6050_D2
00459 #define MPU6050_MOT_ZNEG  MPU6050_D3
00460 #define MPU6050_MOT_YPOS  MPU6050_D4
00461 #define MPU6050_MOT_YNEG  MPU6050_D5
00462 #define MPU6050_MOT_XPOS  MPU6050_D6
00463 #define MPU6050_MOT_XNEG  MPU6050_D7
00464 
00465 // IC2_MST_DELAY_CTRL Register
00466 // These are the names for the bits.
00467 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00468 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV0_DLY_EN MPU6050_D0
00469 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV1_DLY_EN MPU6050_D1
00470 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV2_DLY_EN MPU6050_D2
00471 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV3_DLY_EN MPU6050_D3
00472 #define MPU6050_I2C_SLV4_DLY_EN MPU6050_D4
00473 #define MPU6050_DELAY_ES_SHADOW MPU6050_D7
00474 
00475 // SIGNAL_PATH_RESET Register
00476 // These are the names for the bits.
00477 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00478 #define MPU6050_TEMP_RESET  MPU6050_D0
00479 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_RESET MPU6050_D1
00480 #define MPU6050_GYRO_RESET  MPU6050_D2
00481 
00482 // MOT_DETECT_CTRL Register
00483 // These are the names for the bits.
00484 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00485 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT0      MPU6050_D0
00486 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT1      MPU6050_D1
00487 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT0       MPU6050_D2
00488 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT1       MPU6050_D3
00489 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY0 MPU6050_D4
00490 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY1 MPU6050_D5
00491 
00492 // Combined definitions for the MOT_COUNT
00493 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT_0 (0)
00494 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT_1 (bit(MPU6050_MOT_COUNT0))
00495 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT_2 (bit(MPU6050_MOT_COUNT1))
00496 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT_3 (bit(MPU6050_MOT_COUNT1)|bit(MPU6050_MOT_COUNT0))
00497 
00498 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00499 #define MPU6050_MOT_COUNT_RESET MPU6050_MOT_COUNT_0
00500 
00501 // Combined definitions for the FF_COUNT
00502 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT_0 (0)
00503 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT_1 (bit(MPU6050_FF_COUNT0))
00504 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT_2 (bit(MPU6050_FF_COUNT1))
00505 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT_3 (bit(MPU6050_FF_COUNT1)|bit(MPU6050_FF_COUNT0))
00506 
00507 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00508 #define MPU6050_FF_COUNT_RESET MPU6050_FF_COUNT_0
00509 
00510 // Combined definitions for the ACCEL_ON_DELAY
00511 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_0 (0)
00512 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_1 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY0))
00513 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_2 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY1))
00514 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_3 (bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY1)|bit(MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY0))
00515 
00516 // Alternative names for the ACCEL_ON_DELAY
00517 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_0MS MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_0
00518 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_1MS MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_1
00519 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_2MS MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_2
00520 #define MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_3MS MPU6050_ACCEL_ON_DELAY_3
00521 
00522 // USER_CTRL Register
00523 // These are the names for the bits.
00524 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00525 #define MPU6050_SIG_COND_RESET MPU6050_D0
00526 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_RESET  MPU6050_D1
00527 #define MPU6050_FIFO_RESET     MPU6050_D2
00528 #define MPU6050_I2C_IF_DIS     MPU6050_D4   // must be 0 for MPU-6050
00529 #define MPU6050_I2C_MST_EN     MPU6050_D5
00530 #define MPU6050_FIFO_EN        MPU6050_D6
00531 
00532 // PWR_MGMT_1 Register
00533 // These are the names for the bits.
00534 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00535 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL0      MPU6050_D0
00536 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL1      MPU6050_D1
00537 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL2      MPU6050_D2
00538 #define MPU6050_TEMP_DIS     MPU6050_D3    // 1: disable temperature sensor
00539 #define MPU6050_CYCLE        MPU6050_D5    // 1: sample and sleep
00540 #define MPU6050_SLEEP        MPU6050_D6    // 1: sleep mode
00541 #define MPU6050_DEVICE_RESET MPU6050_D7    // 1: reset to default values
00542 
00543 // Combined definitions for the CLKSEL
00544 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_0 (0)
00545 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_1 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL0))
00546 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_2 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL1))
00547 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_3 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL1)|bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL0))
00548 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_4 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL2))
00549 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_5 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL2)|bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL0))
00550 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_6 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL2)|bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL1))
00551 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_7 (bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL2)|bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL1)|bit(MPU6050_CLKSEL0))
00552 
00553 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00554 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_INTERNAL    MPU6050_CLKSEL_0
00555 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_X           MPU6050_CLKSEL_1
00556 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_Y           MPU6050_CLKSEL_2
00557 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_Z           MPU6050_CLKSEL_3
00558 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_EXT_32KHZ   MPU6050_CLKSEL_4
00559 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_EXT_19_2MHZ MPU6050_CLKSEL_5
00560 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_RESERVED    MPU6050_CLKSEL_6
00561 #define MPU6050_CLKSEL_STOP        MPU6050_CLKSEL_7
00562 
00563 // PWR_MGMT_2 Register
00564 // These are the names for the bits.
00565 // Use these only with the bit() macro.
00566 #define MPU6050_STBY_ZG       MPU6050_D0
00567 #define MPU6050_STBY_YG       MPU6050_D1
00568 #define MPU6050_STBY_XG       MPU6050_D2
00569 #define MPU6050_STBY_ZA       MPU6050_D3
00570 #define MPU6050_STBY_YA       MPU6050_D4
00571 #define MPU6050_STBY_XA       MPU6050_D5
00572 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL0 MPU6050_D6
00573 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL1 MPU6050_D7
00574 
00575 // Combined definitions for the LP_WAKE_CTRL
00576 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_0 (0)
00577 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_1 (bit(MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL0))
00578 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_2 (bit(MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL1))
00579 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_3 (bit(MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL1)|bit(MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL0))
00580 
00581 // Alternative names for the combined definitions
00582 // The names uses the Wake-up Frequency.
00583 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_1_25HZ MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_0
00584 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_2_5HZ  MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_1
00585 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_5HZ    MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_2
00586 #define MPU6050_LP_WAKE_10HZ   MPU6050_LP_WAKE_CTRL_3
00587 
00588 
00589 // Default I2C address for the MPU-6050 is 0x68.
00590 // But only if the AD0 pin is low.
00591 // Some sensor boards have AD0 high, and the
00592 // I2C address thus becomes 0x69.
00593 #define MPU6050_I2C_ADDRESS 0x68
00594 
00595 
00596 
00597 static const double C_DEG_TO_RAD    =  0.017453293;
00598 static const double C_RAD_TO_DEG    = 57.295779506;
00599 
00600 
00601 Mpu6050::Mpu6050()
00602     :   m_accelerometerRange( AccelerometerRange_2g )
00603     ,   m_forceVector( 1 )
00604     ,   m_gyroRange( GyroRange250deg_s )
00605     ,   m_whoAmI( 0x00 )
00606 {
00607 
00608 }
00609 
00610 
00611 int Mpu6050::accelerometerCountsPerG() const
00612 {
00613     int ret = 1;
00614 
00615     switch( this->m_accelerometerRange )
00616     {
00617         case AccelerometerRange_2g:
00618             ret = 16384;
00619             break;
00620 
00621         case AccelerometerRange_4g:
00622             ret = 8192;
00623             break;
00624 
00625         case AccelerometerRange_8g:
00626             ret = 4096;
00627             break;
00628 
00629         case AccelerometerRange_16g:
00630             ret = 2048;
00631             break;
00632 
00633         default:
00634             ret = 1;
00635             break;
00636     }
00637 
00638     return ret;
00639 }
00640 
00641 double  Mpu6050::accelX_g() const
00642 {
00643     return this->rawAccelX() / ((double)this->accelerometerCountsPerG() );
00644 }
00645 
00646 double  Mpu6050::accelY_g() const
00647 {
00648     return this->rawAccelY() / ((double)this->accelerometerCountsPerG() );
00649 }
00650 
00651 double  Mpu6050::accelZ_g() const
00652 {
00653     return this->rawAccelZ() / ((double)this->accelerometerCountsPerG() );
00654 }
00655 
00656 double  Mpu6050::angleX_deg() const
00657 {
00658     return acos( this->accelX_g() / this->m_forceVector ) * C_RAD_TO_DEG;
00659 }
00660 
00661 double  Mpu6050::angleY_deg() const
00662 {
00663     return acos( this->accelY_g() / this->m_forceVector ) * C_RAD_TO_DEG;
00664 }
00665 
00666 double  Mpu6050::angleZ_deg() const
00667 {
00668     return acos( this->accelZ_g() / this->m_forceVector ) * C_RAD_TO_DEG;
00669 }
00670 
00671 void    Mpu6050::clearData()
00672 {
00673     this->m_data.value.x_accel  = 0;
00674     this->m_data.value.y_accel  = 0;
00675     this->m_data.value.z_accel  = 0;
00676 
00677     this->m_data.value.x_gyro  = 0;
00678     this->m_data.value.y_gyro  = 0;
00679     this->m_data.value.z_gyro  = 0;
00680 
00681     this->m_data.value.temperature  = 0;
00682 }
00683 
00684 float Mpu6050::gyroscopeCountsPerDeg_s() const
00685 {
00686     float ret = 1;
00687 
00688     switch( this->m_gyroRange )
00689     {
00690         case GyroRange250deg_s:
00691             ret = 131;
00692             break;
00693 
00694         case GyroRange500deg_s:
00695             ret = 65.5;
00696             break;
00697 
00698         case GyroRange1000deg_s:
00699             ret = 32.8;
00700             break;
00701 
00702         case GyroRange2000deg_s:
00703             ret = 16.4;
00704             break;
00705 
00706         default:
00707             ret = 1;
00708             break;
00709     }
00710 
00711     return ret;
00712 }
00713 
00714 double  Mpu6050::gyroX_deg_s() const
00715 {
00716     return this->rawGyroX() / ((double)this->gyroscopeCountsPerDeg_s() );
00717 }
00718 
00719 double  Mpu6050::gyroY_deg_s() const
00720 {
00721     return this->rawGyroY() / ((double)this->gyroscopeCountsPerDeg_s() );
00722 }
00723 
00724 double  Mpu6050::gyroZ_deg_s() const
00725 {
00726     return this->rawGyroZ() / ((double)this->gyroscopeCountsPerDeg_s() );
00727 }
00728 
00729 bool    Mpu6050::init(String *argErrorString)
00730 {
00731     uint8_t c;
00732     int     error = 0;
00733 
00734 
00735     /* Initialize the 'Wire' class for the I2C-bus. */
00736     LOGLN( "Init Wire..............................." );
00737     Wire.begin();
00738     LOGLN( "Init Wire.......................[  OK  ]" );
00739 
00740 
00741     // default at power-up:
00742     //    Gyro at 250 degrees second
00743     //    Acceleration at 2g
00744     //    Clock source at internal 8MHz
00745     //    The device is in sleep mode.
00746     //
00747 
00748     LOGLN( "Reading WhoAmI.........................." );
00749     error = this->read( MPU6050_WHO_AM_I, &this->m_whoAmI, 1 );
00750     if( error != 0 ) {
00751         LOGLN( "Reading WhoAmI..................[ERREUR]" );
00752         if( argErrorString != 0 ) {
00753             *argErrorString = String( "Can't fetch who i am" );
00754         }
00755         return false;
00756     }
00757     LOGLN( "Reading WhoAmI..................[  OK  ]" );
00758 
00759     // According to the datasheet, the 'sleep' bit
00760     // should read a '1'. But I read a '0'.
00761     // That bit has to be cleared, since the sensor
00762     // is in sleep mode at power-up. Even if the
00763     // bit reads '0'.
00764     LOGLN( "Reading PowerManagement................." );
00765     error = this->read( MPU6050_PWR_MGMT_2, &c, 1 );
00766     if( error != 0 ) {
00767         if( argErrorString != 0 ) {
00768             *argErrorString = String( "Can't fetch sleep bit" );
00769         }
00770         LOGLN( "Reading PowerManagement.........[ERREUR]" );
00771         return false;
00772     }
00773     LOGLN( "Reading PowerManagement.........[  OK  ]" );
00774 
00775 
00776     /* Clear the 'sleep' bit to start the sensor. */
00777     LOGLN( "Clear 'sleep' bit......................." );
00778     this->write_reg( MPU6050_PWR_MGMT_1, 0 );
00779     LOGLN( "Clear 'sleep' bit...............[  OK  ]" );
00780 
00781 
00782     /* Get the accelerometer's config */
00783     LOGLN( "Get the accelerometer config............" );
00784     uint8_t reg_content;
00785     this->read( MPU6050_ACCEL_CONFIG, &reg_content, 1 );
00786 
00787 
00788     if( ( reg_content & MPU6050_AFS_SEL_16G ) == MPU6050_AFS_SEL_16G ) {
00789         this->m_accelerometerRange  = AccelerometerRange_16g;
00790     } else if( ( reg_content & MPU6050_AFS_SEL_8G ) == MPU6050_AFS_SEL_8G ) {
00791         this->m_accelerometerRange  = AccelerometerRange_8g;
00792     } else if( ( reg_content & MPU6050_AFS_SEL_4G ) == MPU6050_AFS_SEL_4G ) {
00793         this->m_accelerometerRange  = AccelerometerRange_4g;
00794     } else if( (reg_content & MPU6050_AFS_SEL_2G) == MPU6050_AFS_SEL_2G ) {
00795         this->m_accelerometerRange  = AccelerometerRange_2g;
00796     }
00797     LOGLN( "Get the accelerometer config....[  OK  ]" );
00798 
00799 
00800     /* Get the gyro config */
00801     LOGLN( "Get the gyro config....................." );
00802     this->read( MPU6050_GYRO_CONFIG, &reg_content, 1 );
00803     if( (reg_content & MPU6050_FS_SEL_2000) == MPU6050_FS_SEL_2000 ) {
00804         this->m_gyroRange   = GyroRange2000deg_s;
00805     } else if( (reg_content & MPU6050_FS_SEL_1000) == MPU6050_FS_SEL_1000 ) {
00806         this->m_gyroRange   = GyroRange1000deg_s;
00807     } else if( (reg_content & MPU6050_FS_SEL_500) == MPU6050_FS_SEL_500 ) {
00808         this->m_gyroRange   = GyroRange500deg_s;
00809     } else if( (reg_content & MPU6050_FS_SEL_250) == MPU6050_FS_SEL_250 ) {
00810         this->m_gyroRange   = GyroRange250deg_s;
00811     }
00812     LOGLN( "Get the gyro config.............[  OK  ]" );
00813 
00814 
00815 
00816 //    Serial.print( "MPU6050_ACCEL_CONFIG register == 0b" );
00817 //    Serial.print( reg_content, BIN );
00818 //    Serial.println( "" );
00819 
00820     return true;
00821 }

00857 
00858 int Mpu6050::read(int start, uint8_t *buffer, int size)
00859 {
00860     int i, n;
00861 
00862     Wire.beginTransmission( MPU6050_I2C_ADDRESS );
00863     n = Wire.write(start);
00864     if (n != 1)
00865         return (-10);
00866 
00867     n = Wire.endTransmission(false);    // hold the I2C-bus
00868     if (n != 0)
00869         return (n);
00870 
00871     // Third parameter is true: relase I2C-bus after data is read.
00872     Wire.requestFrom(MPU6050_I2C_ADDRESS, size, true);
00873     i = 0;
00874     while(Wire.available() && i<size)
00875     {
00876         buffer[i++]=Wire.read();
00877     }
00878     if ( i != size) {
00879         Serial.print( "i==" ); Serial.print( i, DEC );
00880         Serial.print( " != size==" ); Serial.println( size, DEC );
00881         Serial.print( "start==" ); Serial.println( start, DEC );
00882         return (-11);
00883     }
00884 
00885     return (0);  // return : no error
00886 }
00887 
00888 double  Mpu6050::temperature_celsius() const
00889 {
00890     // The temperature sensor is -40 to +85 degrees Celsius.
00891     // It is a signed integer.
00892     // According to the datasheet:
00893     //   340 per degrees Celsius, -512 at 35 degrees.
00894     // At 0 degrees: -512 - (340 * 35) = -12412
00895 
00896     return ( (double) this->m_data.value.temperature + 12412.0) / 340.0;
00897 }
00898 
00899 bool    Mpu6050::updateData()
00900 {
00901     int error = 0;
00902 
00903     // Read the raw values.
00904     // Read 14 bytes at once,
00905     // containing acceleration, temperature and gyro.
00906     // With the default settings of the MPU-6050,
00907     // there is no filter enabled, and the values
00908     // are not very stable.
00909     error = this->read( MPU6050_ACCEL_XOUT_H,
00910                         (uint8_t *) &this->m_data,
00911                         sizeof( this->m_data ) );
00912     if( error != 0 ) {
00913     Serial.print(F(" Mpu6050::updateData() ==>reading  accel, temp and gyro, error = "));
00914     Serial.println(error,DEC);
00915 
00916         this->clearData();
00917         return false;
00918     }
00919 
00920 
00921     // Swap all high and low bytes.
00922     // After this, the registers values are swapped,
00923     // so the structure name like x_accel_l does no
00924     // longer contain the lower byte.
00925     uint8_t swap;
00926 #define SWAP(x,y) swap = x; x = y; y = swap
00927 
00928     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.x_accel_h, this->m_data.reg.x_accel_l);
00929     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.y_accel_h, this->m_data.reg.y_accel_l);
00930     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.z_accel_h, this->m_data.reg.z_accel_l);
00931     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.t_h, this->m_data.reg.t_l);
00932     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.x_gyro_h, this->m_data.reg.x_gyro_l);
00933     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.y_gyro_h, this->m_data.reg.y_gyro_l);
00934     SWAP (this->m_data.reg.z_gyro_h, this->m_data.reg.z_gyro_l);
00935 
00936 
00937 
00938     /* calculating force vector's length (for angular calculus) */
00939     this->m_forceVector = sqrt(   pow( this->accelX_g(), 2 )
00940                                 + pow( this->accelY_g(), 2 )
00941                                 + pow( this->accelZ_g(), 2 ) );
00942 
00943     return true;
00944 }
00945 
00946 uint8_t Mpu6050::whoAmI() const
00947 {
00948     return this->m_whoAmI;
00949 }
00950 
00951 int Mpu6050::write(int start, const uint8_t *pData, int size)
00952 {
00953     int n, error;
00954 
00955     Wire.beginTransmission(MPU6050_I2C_ADDRESS);
00956     n = Wire.write(start);        // write the start address
00957     if (n != 1)
00958         return (-20);
00959 
00960     n = Wire.write(pData, size);  // write data bytes
00961     if (n != size)
00962         return (-21);
00963 
00964     error = Wire.endTransmission(true); // release the I2C-bus
00965     if (error != 0)
00966         return (error);
00967 
00968     return (0);         // return : no error
00969 }
00970 
00971 
00972 int Mpu6050::write_reg(int reg, uint8_t data)
00973 {
00974     int error;
00975 
00976     error = this->write( reg, &data, 1 );
00977 
00978     return (error);
00979 }
